item.title: [Global][VMware] - VMware Remote Console
item.description:
Jan 6, 18:12 UTC
Update - We'll get back to you as soon as we have more information.

Jan 6, 18:10 UTC
Monitoring - Start time : 08/12/2022 09:00 UTC
User impact : VMware Remote Console (VMRC) in "legacy connection mode" (cf https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/76672) is not working anymore with last Hosted Private Cloud infrastructure upgrades.
Root cause : A configuration change on the "SSL gateway" (the machine that acts as a bridge & firewall between your Hosted Private Cloud and the internet and allows you to connect to the vSphere web client among others things) required to adress the VMSA-2022-0030 pulished in december https://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2022-0030.html
Workaround : We are actively working on a solution to bring back VMRC. In the meantime, you can use the "Web Remote Console" available in your vSphere Web Client.

Note : We will probably not bring back the VMRC "legacy connection mode" (port 902) because it conflicts with the configuration change required to adress the VMSA-2022-0030. Instead, we are currently working on a solution to allow the VMRC "standard connection mode" (port 443). Once deployed, if you previously used the "legacy connection mode" you'll have to remove the custom configuration on your workstation, refer to "Resolution" section of this VMware guide : https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/76672 to find the lines to remove.

item.title: [Global][Dedicated Cloud] - End of Life Dedicated Cloud
item.description:
Dec 20, 10:00 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Jul 25, 13:27 UTC
Scheduled - End of Life Dedicated Cloud: 30 September 2022
We informed you in October 2021 that our Dedicad Cloud service will reach its end of life and will be discontinued the 30st September 2022. This step is important for your VMware platforms to improve the quality of service, performance, and security of your clusters. Indeed, "Dedicated Cloud" hardware used, pre-2016, does not allow us to provide the best level of service and integration with new modern architectures of VMware.
Following our previous email, many customers started to plan and/or to migrate and we encourage you to do the same to avoid the September deadline.

Guide to migrating to a new infrastructure:
https://docs.ovh.com/gb/en/private-cloud/vdc-migration/

item.description:
Dec 14, 08:57 UTC
Resolved - Start Time : 13/12/2022 14:00
End Time : 14/12/2022 05:00
Root cause : An ongoing operation caused the delay observed
Our technical teams resolved the issue. All impacted services are now operational.

Dec 13, 16:43 UTC
Update - Our technical teams identified that the degradation had also affected the public network and all the operations around the IP blocks (purchase, removal etc.).

Dec 13, 16:17 UTC
Investigating - Please note the incident on ipblock from vrack

Following all the necessary information.

Start time: 13/12/2022 14:00
Service impact :Add/Remove of ipblock from vrack can take long times to be performed.
Ongoing Actions:Our technical teams investigate to determine the origin of the degradation

Thank you for your understanding

OVHcloud Technical team
